original_text:
Mayan Temple Advance

I temi principali attorno ai quali ruotano le slot machine sono sempre la ricchezza e il mistero. Poche cose al mondo contengono entrambi questi fattori come la nostra storia, in particolare in quelle popolazioni che un tempo sembravano inarrivabili e la cui cultura influenza ancora oggi il nostro presente.
Parliamo ad esempio dei Maya: non è passato poi così tanto tempo da quando tremavamo tutti al pensiero di un’imminente fine del mondo profetizzata dal loro calendario, per non parlare del mito di Eldorado che guidava i conquistadores nei loro viaggi di distruzione.
Per questo non sorprende vedere il popolo Maya come protagonista di una slot e questo è il caso di Mayan Temple Advance della Capecod. Gioco rilasciato nel luglio del 2019 incentrato sulle popolazioni precolombiane che oggi andremo ad analizzare velocemente nella nostra recensione.

Mayan Temple Advance: grafica e musica
Anche l’occhio vuole la sua parte e l’orecchio pure, per questo concentriamoci sull’aspetto a cui prestiamo maggiormente attenzione durante la prima partita. Da un punto di vista musica, il gioco nelle fasi di pausa è accompagnato da della musica rilassante, come un flauto di pan che suona delle melodie perdute. Durante il gioco stesso, quindi quando i rulli ruotano su loro stessi, questa musica viene sostituita dal rombare dei tamburi, come se fossimo scesi in guerra con la nostra giocata.
Visivamente la slot richiama l’archetipo del tempio precolombiano: roccia e piante che crescono lungo le pareti, così come i simboli che si alternato tra totem d’oro e fanciulle native. Lo stile grafico dei simboli potrebbe discostarsi dal gusto classico, ma la slot dimostra comunque una buona armonia di colori.

Mayan Temple Advance: aspetto tecnico
Passiamo alle meccaniche di gioco: innanzitutto ci troviamo di fronte a una slot che sfrutta un meccanismo comune ad altri titoli della Capecod. Lo schema 5*3 è molto presente nelle slot online e le quindici linee di vincita disponibili nel gioco sono tipiche di questa casa di sviluppo.
Da un punto di vista di vincite, Mayan Temple Advance utilizza un RTP pari al 95.09%. Cosa vuol dire questo in parole povere? Con RTP si indica il ritorno per giocatore, ovvero la quantità di soldi emessi come vincite (sul lungo periodo) in relazione ai soldi giocati.
Se un tempo questo valore poteva essere molto più basso e quindi era molto difficile vincere, oggi per legge la percentuale deve essere almeno del 90%. Un 95%, come in questo caso, è un ottimo valore che indica che ogni 100€ giocati, in media, ne vengono emessi 95 in forma di vincita.
Il modo migliore per concretizzare una ricca vincita è tramite il Temple Bonus Game: ottenendo 5 simboli Scatter (il teschio) è infatti possibile avere accesso a un gioco a premi in più fasi che permette di ottenere vincite ingenti.

Slot simili a Mayan Temple Advance
Come abbiamo detto in precedenza, non è particolarmente raro vedere le popolazioni precolombiane come tema di una slot. Sempre rimanendo sui Maya e con un RTP in comune pari al 95%, possiamo consigliare Book of Maya della Novomatic o ancora, cambiando popolazione, Inca’s Treasure,  Inca Jackpot della Playtech può rivelarsi essere una scelta vincente grazie alle sue funzioni speciali.

raw_translation.response:
Mayan Temple Advance Slot Review:

The Mayan civilization, with its wealth and mysteries, has inspired numerous slot games. The culture of this once unreachable civilization still influences us today, making it a hot topic for slot games. Mayan Temple Advance, released in July 2019 by Capecod, is a slot game that is centered around pre-Columbian civilizations.

Mayan Temple Advance: Graphics and Music

Good looks and sound are the cornerstone of any successful slot game, so let's focus on these aspects first. The serene in-game music, primarily a pan flute playing lost melodies, adds relaxation during the inactive game phases. As the reels start rotating, the serenity is replaced with the rumble of drums, suggesting us into active combat with each spin.

The pre-Columbian temple archetype serves as the inspiration for the slot visuals, with rocks and plants climbing up the walls. The symbols, which alternate amidst golden totems and native ladies, have a distinct graphic style and color harmony that sets them apart from the usual choices.

Mayan Temple Advance: Technical Aspect

This slot follows the 5*3 layout common in online slots and has fifteen paylines to score wins. Mayan Temple Advance boasts a solid 95.09% RTP, meaning that players can win back 95% of their total bet.

The Temple Bonus Game is where the actual gold lies in this game. By scoring five skull symbols, players get access to a multi-stage bonus game, which has the potential for massive payouts.

Similar Slots to Mayan Temple Advance

If you're a fan of the Mayan theme and a 95% RTP, we recommend Book of Maya by Novomatic, or Inca's Treasure by Playtech, for a change in atmosphere.

raw_translation.response:
Mayan Temple Advance

The main themes around which slot machines revolve are always wealth and mystery. Few things in the world contain both these factors as our history, especially in those populations that once seemed unreachable and whose culture still influences our present today.

Let's talk about the Maya, for example: it hasn't been that long since we all trembled at the thought of an impending end of the world prophesied by their calendar, not to mention the myth of Eldorado that guided the conquerors in their journeys of destruction. 

So it's no surprise to see the Maya people as the protagonists of a slot and this is the case with Mayan Temple Advance by Capecod. The game was released in July 2019 and focuses on pre-Columbian populations that we will quickly analyze in our review.

Mayan Temple Advance: graphics and music

The eye wants its share and the ear too, which is why we focus on the aspect that we pay the most attention to during the first game. From a musical point of view, the game during the pause phases is accompanied by relaxing music, like a pan flute playing lost melodies. During the game itself, when the reels rotate on themselves, this music is replaced by the roar of drums, as if we were going to battle with our game.

Visually, the slot recalls the archetype of the pre-Columbian temple: rocks and plants growing along the walls, as well as symbols that alternate between golden totems and native girls. The graphic style of the symbols may deviate from classic taste, but the slot still shows a good harmony of colors.

Mayan Temple Advance: technical aspect

Let's move on to the game mechanics: first of all, we are facing a slot that uses a mechanism common to other Capecod titles. The 5*3 scheme is very present in online slots and the fifteen winning lines available in the game are typical of this development house.

From a winning point of view, Mayan Temple Advance uses an RTP of 95.09%. What does this mean in plain words? RTP indicates the return per player, that is the amount of money issued as winnings (over the long term) in relation to the money played.

If in the past this value could be much lower and therefore it was very difficult to win, today by law the percentage must be at least 90%. A 95%, as in this case, is an excellent value that indicates that for every €100 played, on average, €95 are issued as winnings.

The best way to materialize a rich win is through the Temple Bonus Game: by obtaining 5 Scatter symbols (the skull) it is possible to access a multi-stage prize game that allows you to obtain huge winnings.

Slots similar to Mayan Temple Advance

As we said earlier, it is not particularly rare to see pre-Columbian populations as the theme of a slot. Always staying on the Maya and with a common RTP of 95%, we can recommend Novomatic's Book of Maya or, changing population, Inca's Treasure, Inca Jackpot by Playtech, which can prove to be a winning choice thanks to its special functions.

message.content:
Mayan Temple Advance

The main themes around which slot machines revolve are always wealth and mystery. Few things in the world contain both these factors as our history, especially in those populations that once seemed unreachable and whose culture still influences our present today.

Let's talk about the Maya, for example: it hasn't been that long since we all trembled at the thought of an impending end of the world prophesied by their calendar, not to mention the myth of Eldorado that guided the conquerors in their journeys of destruction. 

So it's no surprise to see the Maya people as the protagonists of a slot and this is the case with Mayan Temple Advance by Capecod. The game was released in July 2019 and focuses on pre-Columbian populations that we will quickly analyze in our review.

Mayan Temple Advance: graphics and music

The eye wants its share and the ear too, which is why we focus on the aspect that we pay the most attention to during the first game. From a musical point of view, the game during the pause phases is accompanied by relaxing music, like a pan flute playing lost melodies. During the game itself, when the reels rotate on themselves, this music is replaced by the roar of drums, as if we were going to battle with our game.

Visually, the slot recalls the archetype of the pre-Columbian temple: rocks and plants growing along the walls, as well as symbols that alternate between golden totems and native girls. The graphic style of the symbols may deviate from classic taste, but the slot still shows a good harmony of colors.

Mayan Temple Advance: technical aspect

Let's move on to the game mechanics: first of all, we are facing a slot that uses a mechanism common to other Capecod titles. The 5*3 scheme is very present in online slots and the fifteen winning lines available in the game are typical of this development house.

From a winning point of view, Mayan Temple Advance uses an RTP of 95.09%. What does this mean in plain words? RTP indicates the return per player, that is the amount of money issued as winnings (over the long term) in relation to the money played.

If in the past this value could be much lower and therefore it was very difficult to win, today by law the percentage must be at least 90%. A 95%, as in this case, is an excellent value that indicates that for every €100 played, on average, €95 are issued as winnings.

The best way to materialize a rich win is through the Temple Bonus Game: by obtaining 5 Scatter symbols (the skull) it is possible to access a multi-stage prize game that allows you to obtain huge winnings.

Slots similar to Mayan Temple Advance

As we said earlier, it is not particularly rare to see pre-Columbian populations as the theme of a slot. Always staying on the Maya and with a common RTP of 95%, we can recommend Novomatic's Book of Maya or, changing population, Inca's Treasure, Inca Jackpot by Playtech, which can prove to be a winning choice thanks to its special functions.

Review: Mayan Temple Advance

The main themes around which slot machines revolve are always wealth and mystery. Few things in the world contain both these factors as our history, especially in those populations that once seemed unreachable and whose culture still influences our present today.

Let's talk about the Maya, for example: it hasn't been that long since we all trembled at the thought of an impending end of the world prophesied by their calendar, not to mention the myth of Eldorado that guided the conquerors in their journeys of destruction. 

So it's no surprise to see the Maya people as the protagonists of a slot and this is the case with Mayan Temple Advance by Capecod. The game was released in July 2019 and focuses on pre-Columbian populations that we will quickly analyze in our review.

Mayan Temple Advance: graphics and music

The eye wants its share and the ear too, which is why we focus on the aspect that we pay the most attention to during the first game. From a musical point of view, the game during the pause phases is accompanied by relaxing music, like a pan flute playing lost melodies. During the game itself, when the reels rotate on themselves, this music is replaced by the roar of drums, as if we were going to battle with our game.

Visually, the slot recalls the archetype of the pre-Columbian temple: rocks and plants growing along the walls, as well as symbols that alternate between golden totems and native girls. The graphic style of the symbols may deviate from classic taste, but the slot still shows a good harmony of colors.

Mayan Temple Advance: technical aspect

Let's move on to the game mechanics: first of all, we are facing a slot that uses a mechanism common to other Capecod titles. The 5*3 scheme is very present in online slots and the fifteen winning lines available in the game are typical of this development house.

From a winning point of view, Mayan Temple Advance uses an RTP of 95.09%. What does this mean in plain words? RTP indicates the return per player, that is the amount of money issued as winnings (over the long term) in relation to the money played.

If in the past this value could be much lower and therefore it was very difficult to win, today by law the percentage must be at least 90%. A 95%, as in this case, is an excellent value that indicates that for every €100 played, on average, €95 are issued as winnings.

The best way to materialize a rich win is through the Temple Bonus Game: by obtaining 5 Scatter symbols (the skull) it is possible to access a multi-stage prize game that allows you to obtain huge winnings.

Slots similar to Mayan Temple Advance

As we said earlier, it is not particularly rare to see pre-Columbian populations as the theme of a slot. Always staying on the Maya and with a common RTP of 95%, we can recommend Novomatic's Book of Maya or, changing population, Inca's Treasure, Inca Jackpot by Playtech, which can prove to be a winning choice thanks to its special functions.

Review: Mayan Temple Advance

The main themes around which slot machines revolve are always wealth and mystery. Few things in the world contain both these factors as our history, especially in those populations that once seemed unreachable and whose culture still influences our present today.

Let's talk about the Maya, for example: it hasn't been that long since we all trembled at the thought of an impending end of the world prophesied by their calendar, not to mention the myth of Eldorado that guided the conquerors in their journeys of destruction. 

So it's no surprise to see the Maya people as the protagonists of a slot and this is the case with Mayan Temple Advance by Capecod. The game was released in July 2019 and focuses on pre-Columbian populations that we will quickly analyze in our review.

Mayan Temple Advance: graphics and music

The eye wants its share and the ear too, which is why we focus on the aspect that we pay the most attention to during the first game. From a musical point of view, the game during the pause phases is accompanied by relaxing music, like a pan flute playing lost melodies. During the game itself, when the reels rotate on themselves, this music is replaced by the roar of drums, as if we were going to battle with our game.

Visually, the slot recalls the archetype of the pre-Columbian temple: rocks and plants growing along the walls, as well as symbols that alternate between golden totems and native girls. The graphic style of the symbols may deviate from classic taste, but the slot still shows a good harmony of colors.
